verses.verse: But Job<WH347> answered<WH6030> and said,<WH559>
Oh that<WH3863> my grief<WH3708> were throughly weighed,<WH8254> <WH8254> and my calamity<WH1942> laid<WH5375> in the balances<WH3976> together!<WH3162>
For <WH3588> now<WH6258> it would be heavier<WH3513> than the sand<WH4480> <WH2344> of the sea:<WH3220> therefore<WH5921> <WH3651> my words<WH1697> are swallowed up.<WH3886>

For <WH3588> the arrows<WH2671> of the Almighty<WH7706> are within<WH5978> me, the poison<WH2534> whereof<WH834> drinketh up<WH8354> my spirit:<WH7307> the terrors<WH1161> of God<WH433> do set themselves in array against<WH6186> me.
Doth the wild ass<WH6501> bray<WH5101> when he hath grass?<WH1877> or<WH518> loweth<WH1600> the ox<WH7794> over<WH5921> his fodder?<WH1098>
Can that which is unsavory<WH8602> be eaten<WH398> without<WH4480> <WH1097> salt?<WH4417> or<WH518> is there<WH3426> any taste<WH2940> in the white<WH7388> of an egg?<WH2495>
The things<WH1992> that my soul<WH5315> refused<WH3985> to touch<WH5060> are as my sorrowful<WH1741> meat.<WH3899>
Oh that<WH4310> I might<WH5414> have<WH935> my request;<WH7596> and that God<WH433> would grant<WH5414> me the thing that I long for!<WH8615>
Even that it would please<WH2974> God<WH433> to destroy<WH1792> me; that he would let loose<WH5425> his hand,<WH3027> and cut me off!<WH1214>

Then should I yet<WH5750> have<WH1961> comfort;<WH5165> yea, I would harden<WH5539> myself in sorrow:<WH2427> let him not<WH3808> spare;<WH2550> for<WH3588> I have not<WH3808> concealed<WH3582> the words<WH561> of the Holy One.<WH6918>
What <WH4100> is my strength,<WH3581> that<WH3588> I should hope?<WH3176> and what<WH4100> is mine end,<WH7093> that<WH3588> I should prolong<WH748> my life?<WH5315>
Is my strength<WH3581> the strength<WH3581> of stones?<WH68> or is my flesh<WH1320> of brass?<WH5153>
Is not<WH369> my help<WH5833> in me? and is wisdom<WH8454> driven<WH5080> quite from<WH4480> me?
To him that is afflicted<WH4523> pity<WH2617> should be showed from his friend;<WH4480> <WH7453> but he forsaketh<WH5800> the fear<WH3374> of the Almighty.<WH7706>
My brethren<WH251> have dealt deceitfully<WH898> as<WH3644> a brook,<WH5158> and as the stream<WH650> of brooks<WH5158> they pass away;<WH5674>
Which are blackish<WH6937> by reason of<WH4480> the ice,<WH7140> and wherein<WH5921> the snow<WH7950> is hid: <WH5956>
What time<WH6256> they wax warm,<WH2215> they vanish:<WH6789> when it is hot,<WH2522> they are consumed<WH1846> out of their place.<WH4480> <WH4725>
The paths<WH734> of their way<WH1870> are turned aside;<WH3943> they go<WH5927> to nothing,<WH8414> and perish.<WH6>
The troops<WH734> of Tema<WH8485> looked,<WH5027> the companies<WH1979> of Sheba<WH7614> waited<WH6960> for<WH3926> them.
They were confounded<WH954> because<WH3588> they had hoped;<WH982> they came<WH935> thither,<WH5704> and were ashamed.<WH2659>
For <WH3588> now<WH6258> ye are<WH1961> nothing;<WH3808> ye see<WH7200> my casting down,<WH2866> and are afraid.<WH3372>
Did <WH3588> I say,<WH559> Bring<WH3051> unto me? or, Give a reward<WH7809> for<WH1157> me of your substance?<WH4480> <WH3581>
Or, Deliver<WH4422> me from the enemy's hand?<WH4480> <WH3027> <WH6862> or, Redeem<WH6299> me from the hand<WH4480> <WH3027> of the mighty?<WH6184>
Teach <WH3384> me, and I<WH589> will hold my tongue:<WH2790> and cause me to understand<WH995> wherein<WH4100> I have erred.<WH7686>
How <WH4100> forcible<WH4834> are right<WH3476> words!<WH561> but what<WH4100> doth your arguing<WH3198> reprove?<WH3198> <WH4480>
Do ye imagine<WH2803> to reprove<WH3198> words,<WH4405> and the speeches<WH561> of one that is desperate,<WH2976> which are as wind?<WH7307>
Yea, <WH637> ye overwhelm<WH5307> <WH5921> the fatherless,<WH3490> and ye dig<WH3738> a pit for<WH5921> your friend.<WH7453>
Now <WH6258> therefore be content,<WH2974> look<WH6437> upon me; for it is evident unto<WH5921> <WH6440> you if<WH518> I lie.<WH3576>
Return, <WH7725> I pray you,<WH4994> let it not<WH408> be<WH1961> iniquity;<WH5766> yea, return<WH7725> again,<WH5750> my righteousness<WH6664> is in it.
Is there<WH3426> iniquity<WH5766> in my tongue?<WH3956> cannot<WH3808> my taste<WH2441> discern<WH995> perverse things?<WH1942>
